autosave.label: Enable Reports:
autosave.rightLabel: Create NOAA files after daily rollover
autosave.helper: Enables the creation of the report files

monthfileformat.label: Monthly filename format:
monthfileformat.helper: Specify the filename template using C# date formatting. Default = 'NOAAMO'MMyy'.txt'

yearfileformat.label: Yearly filename format:
yearfileformat.helper: Specify the filename template using C# date formatting. Default = 'NOAAYR'yyyy'.txt'

utf8.label: Text Encoding:
utf8.helper: Create the report files using the UTF-8 file format. Default = enabled

dotdecimal.label: Decimal Point:
dotdecimal.helper: Overrides your local locale setting for decimal points and always uses a dot decimal

minmaxavg.label: Average Calculation:
minmaxavg.helper: The default is it use integrated mean temperatures, enabling this setting uses the traditional method based on max and min temperatures

autotransfer.helper: Enabling this means your NOAA reports will be FTP'd to the folder below after they are created during the daily rollover

dstfolder.label: FTP folder:
helpers: You can specify a different folder from the default FTP folder if you wish to up the reports to a different location
Leaving this blank will mean the reports are placed in the location specified in the main Internet Settings FTP folder
Paths entered here are relative to the FTP root folder

autotransfer.helper: Enabling this means your NOAA reports will be copied to the folder below after they are created during the daily rollover

dstfolder.label: Local copy folder:
helpers: You can specify a different folder from the default local copy folder if you wish to up the reports to a different location
Leaving this blank will mean the reports are placed in the location specified in the main Internet Settings Local Copy destination folder
Note any path entered here should be a full absolute path to the destination folder

heatingthreshold.label: Heating threshold:
helpers: The base temperature which is to be used to calculate heating demand as heating degree days

coolingthreshold.label: Cooling threshold:
helpers: The base temperature which is to be used to calculate chilling demand as cooling degree days

maxtempcomp1.label: Max temp comparison 1:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with max temperatures above this temperature

maxtempcomp2.label: Max temp comparison 2:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with max temperatures below this temperature

mintempcomp1.label: Min temp comparison 1:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with min temperatures below this temperature

mintempcomp2.label: Min temp comparison 2:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with min temperatures below this temperature

raincomp1.label: Rain comparison 1:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with rainfall totals >= this value

raincomp2.label: Rain comparison 2:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with rainfall totals >= this value

raincomp3.label: Rain comparison 3:
helpers: Used in the reports for the counts of days with rainfall totals >= this value
Enter the long term mean monthly temperature values expected for your station
Enter the long term mean monthly rainfall values expected for your station
